  48
  49template <typename T, typename Block>
  50inline void
  51scale_block(T scalar, Block &block)
  52{
  53  typedef expr::Scalar<Block::dim, T> scalar_block_type;
  54  typedef expr::Binary<expr::op::Mult, Block, scalar_block_type, true> expr_block_type;
  55
  56  scalar_block_type scalar_block(scalar);
  57  expr_block_type   expr_block(block, scalar_block);
  58  assign<Block::dim>(block, expr_block);
  59}
  60
  61
  62
  63template <typename       T,
  64	  bool           ComputeInSize,
  65	  typename       BE,
  66	  dimension_type Dim>
  67inline length_type
  68inout_size(BE* backend, Domain<Dim> const& dom)
  69{
  70  Rt_layout<Dim> rtl_in, rtl_out;
  71
  72  rtl_in.pack    = stride_unit_dense;
  73  rtl_in.order   = Rt_tuple(0, 1, 2);
  74  rtl_in.complex = cmplx_inter_fmt;
  75  rtl_in.align   = 0;
  76
  77  rtl_out.pack    = stride_unit_dense;
  78  rtl_out.order   = Rt_tuple(0, 1, 2);
  79  rtl_out.complex = cmplx_inter_fmt;
  80  rtl_out.align   = 0;
  81
  82  backend->query_layout(rtl_in, rtl_out);
  83
  84  if (ComputeInSize)
  85  {
  86    Rt_layout<Dim> rtl_inout;
  87
  88    rtl_inout.pack    = stride_unit_dense;
  89    rtl_inout.order   = Rt_tuple(0, 1, 2);
  90    rtl_inout.complex = cmplx_inter_fmt;
  91    rtl_inout.align   = 0;
  92
  93    backend->query_layout(rtl_inout);
  94
  95    Applied_layout<Rt_layout<Dim> > l_in(rtl_in, extent(dom), sizeof(T));
  96    Applied_layout<Rt_layout<Dim> > l_inout(rtl_inout, extent(dom), sizeof(T));
  97
  98    return std::max(l_in.total_size(), l_inout.total_size());
  99  }
 100  else
 101  {
 102    Applied_layout<Rt_layout<Dim> > layout(rtl_out, extent(dom), sizeof(T));
 103    return layout.total_size();
 104  }
 105}
 106
 107
 108
 109// Determine in-out sizes, for Out-of-Place Only
 110
 111template <typename       T,
 112	  bool           ComputeInSize,
 113	  typename       BE,
 114	  dimension_type Dim>
 115inline length_type
 116inout_size_opo(BE* backend, Domain<Dim> const& dom)
 117{
 118  Rt_layout<Dim> rtl_in, rtl_out;
 119
 120  rtl_in.pack    = stride_unit_dense;
 121  rtl_in.order   = Rt_tuple(0, 1, 2);
 122  rtl_in.complex = cmplx_inter_fmt;
 123  rtl_in.align   = 0;
 124
 125  rtl_out.pack    = stride_unit_dense;
 126  rtl_out.order   = Rt_tuple(0, 1, 2);
 127  rtl_out.complex = cmplx_inter_fmt;
 128  rtl_out.align   = 0;
 129
 130  backend->query_layout(rtl_in, rtl_out);
 131
 132  if (ComputeInSize)
 133  {
 134    Applied_layout<Rt_layout<Dim> > layout(rtl_in, extent(dom), sizeof(T));
 135    return layout.total_size();
 136  }
 137  else
 138  {
 139    Applied_layout<Rt_layout<Dim> > layout(rtl_out, extent(dom), sizeof(T));
 140    return layout.total_size();
 141  }
 142}
 143
 144
 145
 146/// This provides the temporary data as well as the
 147/// conversion logic from blocks to arrays as expected
 148/// by fft backends.
 149template <dimension_type D, typename I, typename O>
 150class workspace;
 151
 152template <typename T>
 153class workspace<1, std::complex<T>, std::complex<T> >
 154{
 155public:
 156  template <typename BE>
 157  workspace(BE* backend, Domain<1> const &in, Domain<1> const &out, T scale)
 158    : scale_(scale),
 159      input_buffer_(in.size()),
 160      output_buffer_(out.size())
 161  {
 162    // Check if Backend supports interleaved unit-stride fastpath:
 163    {
 164      Rt_layout<1> ref;
 165      ref.pack    = stride_unit_dense;
 166      ref.order   = Rt_tuple(row1_type());
 167      ref.complex = cmplx_inter_fmt;
 168      ref.align   = 0;
 169      Rt_layout<1> rtl_in(ref);
 170      Rt_layout<1> rtl_out(ref);
 171      backend->query_layout(rtl_in, rtl_out);
 172      this->inter_fastpath_ok_ = 
 173	rtl_in.pack == ref.pack       && rtl_out.pack == ref.pack &&
 174	// rtl_in.order == ref.order     && rtl_out.order == ref.order &&
 175	rtl_in.complex == ref.complex && rtl_out.complex == ref.complex &&
 176	!backend->requires_copy(rtl_in);
 177    }
 178    // Check if Backend supports split unit-stride fastpath:
 179    {
 180      Rt_layout<1> ref;
 181      ref.pack    = stride_unit_dense;
 182      ref.order   = Rt_tuple(row1_type());
 183      ref.complex = cmplx_split_fmt;
 184      ref.align   = 0;
 185      Rt_layout<1> rtl_in(ref);
 186      Rt_layout<1> rtl_out(ref);
 187      backend->query_layout(rtl_in, rtl_out);
 188      this->split_fastpath_ok_ = 
 189	rtl_in.pack == ref.pack       && rtl_out.pack == ref.pack &&
 190	// rtl_in.order == ref.order     && rtl_out.order == ref.order &&
 191	rtl_in.complex == ref.complex && rtl_out.complex == ref.complex &&
 192	!backend->requires_copy(rtl_in);
 193    }
 194  }
 195  
 196  template <typename BE, typename Block0, typename Block1>
 197  void by_reference_blk(
 198    BE*           backend,
 199    Block0 const& in,
 200    Block1&       out)
 201    const
 202  {
 203    // Find out about the blocks's actual layout.
 204    Rt_layout<1> rtl_in  = block_layout<1>(in);
 205    Rt_layout<1> rtl_out = block_layout<1>(out);
 206    
 207    // Find out about what layout is acceptable for this backend.
 208    backend->query_layout(rtl_in, rtl_out);
 209
 210#if VSIP_IMPL_CUDA_FFT
 211    if (backend->supports_cuda_memory())
 212    {
 213      // The data is either already in device memory or must be brought 
 214      // over before calling the backend.  Device_memory returns a pointer to
 215      // the appropriate memory space depending on the underlying block type.
 216      cuda::Device_memory<Block0 const> dev_in(in, SYNC_IN, &rtl_in);
 217      cuda::Device_memory<Block1> dev_out(out, SYNC_OUT, &rtl_out);
 218
 219      backend->by_reference(const_cast<std::complex<T>*>(dev_in.data()), 1,
 220			    dev_out.data(), 1,
 221			    out.size());
 222    }
 223    else 
 224#endif
 225    {
 226      typedef typename Proper_type_of<Block0>::type proper_block0_type;
 227
 228      // Check whether the input buffer will be destroyed (and hence
 229      // should be a copy), or whether the input block aliases the
 230      // output (and hence should be a copy).
 231      //
 232      // The input and output may alias when using return-block
 233      // optimization for by-value Fft: 'A = fft(A)'.
 234      sync_action_type in_sync =
 235        (backend->requires_copy(rtl_in) || is_alias(in, out))
 236        ? SYNC_IN_NOPRESERVE
 237        : SYNC_IN; 
 238
 239      {
 240        // Create a 'direct data accessor', adjusting the block layout if necessary.
 241        Rt_ext_data<proper_block0_type> in_ext(in, rtl_in, in_sync,
 242          input_buffer_.get());
 243        Rt_ext_data<Block1> out_ext(out, rtl_out, SYNC_OUT,
 244          output_buffer_.get());
 245    
 246        // Call the backend.
 247        assert(rtl_in.complex == rtl_out.complex);
 248        if (rtl_in.complex == cmplx_inter_fmt) 
 249          backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_inter(), in_ext.stride(0),
 250            out_ext.data().as_inter(), out_ext.stride(0),
 251            in_ext.size(0));
 252        else
 253          backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_split(), in_ext.stride(0),
 254            out_ext.data().as_split(), out_ext.stride(0),
 255            in_ext.size(0));
 256      }
 257    }
 258
 259    // Scale the data if not already done by the backend.
 260    if (!backend->supports_scale() && !almost_equal(scale_, T(1.)))
 261      scale_block(scale_, out);
 262  }
 263
 264  template <typename BE, typename Block0, typename Block1>
 265  void by_reference(BE *backend,
 266		    const_Vector<std::complex<T>, Block0>& in,
 267		    Vector<std::complex<T>, Block1>& out)
 268    const
 269  {
 270#if 0
 271    // Unfortunately, calling by_reference_blk adds performance
 272    // overhead for small FFT sizes.
 273    //
 274    // 0703012: On a 2 GHz PPC 970FX, with FFTW 3.1.2, using 'fft -1'
 275    //  - implement inline.      16-point FFT: 1751 MFLOP/s (baseline)
 276    //  - call by_reference_blk. 16-point FFT: 1186 MFLOP/s (-32.2%)
 277
 278    by_reference_blk<BE, Block0, Block1>(backend, in.block(), out.block());
 279#else
 280    // Find out about the blocks's actual layout.
 281    Rt_layout<1> rtl_in = block_layout<1>(in.block()); 
 282    Rt_layout<1> rtl_out = block_layout<1>(out.block()); 
 283    
 284    // Find out about what layout is acceptable for this backend.
 285    backend->query_layout(rtl_in, rtl_out);
 286
 287#if VSIP_IMPL_CUDA_FFT
 288    if (backend->supports_cuda_memory())
 289    {
 290      // The data is either already in device memory or must be brought 
 291      // over before calling the backend.  Device_memory returns a pointer to
 292      // the appropriate memory space depending on the underlying block type.
 293      cuda::Device_memory<Block0 const> dev_in(in.block(), SYNC_IN, &rtl_in);
 294      cuda::Device_memory<Block1> dev_out(out.block(), SYNC_OUT, &rtl_out);
 295      
 296      backend->by_reference(dev_in.data(), dev_in.stride(0),
 297                            dev_out.data(), dev_out.stride(0),
 298			    dev_out.size(0));
 299    }
 300    else
 301#endif
 302    {
 303      typedef typename Block_layout<Block0>::complex_type complex_type;
 304      typedef Layout<1, row1_type, Stride_unit, complex_type> LP;
 305
 306      if (Ext_data_cost<Block0, LP>::value == 0 &&
 307	Ext_data_cost<Block1, LP>::value == 0 &&
 308	Type_equal<complex_type, Cmplx_inter_fmt>::value ?
 309        this->inter_fastpath_ok_ : this->split_fastpath_ok_)
 310      {
 311        Ext_data<Block0, LP> in_ext (in.block(),  SYNC_IN);
 312        Ext_data<Block1, LP> out_ext(out.block(), SYNC_OUT);
 313
 314        backend->by_reference(in_ext.data(),  1,
 315          out_ext.data(), 1,
 316          in_ext.size(0));
 317      }
 318      else
 319      {
 320        // General-path (using RT Ext_data).
 321
 322        // Check whether the input buffer will be destroyed.
 323        sync_action_type in_sync = backend->requires_copy(rtl_in)
 324          ? SYNC_IN_NOPRESERVE
 325          : SYNC_IN; 
 326
 327        {
 328          // Create a 'direct data accessor', adjusting the block layout if
 329          // necessary.
 330          Rt_ext_data<Block0> in_ext(in.block(), rtl_in, in_sync,
 331            input_buffer_.get());
 332          Rt_ext_data<Block1> out_ext(out.block(), rtl_out, SYNC_OUT,
 333            output_buffer_.get());
 334    
 335          // Call the backend.
 336          assert(rtl_in.complex == rtl_out.complex);
 337          if (rtl_in.complex == cmplx_inter_fmt) 
 338            backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_inter(), in_ext.stride(0),
 339              out_ext.data().as_inter(), out_ext.stride(0),
 340              in_ext.size(0));
 341          else
 342            backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_split(), in_ext.stride(0),
 343              out_ext.data().as_split(), out_ext.stride(0),
 344              in_ext.size(0));
 345        }
 346      }
 347    }
 348
 349    // Scale the data if not already done by the backend.
 350    if (!backend->supports_scale() && !almost_equal(scale_, T(1.)))
 351      out *= scale_;
 352#endif
 353  }
 354
 355  template <typename BE, typename BlockT>
 356  void in_place(BE *backend, Vector<std::complex<T>,BlockT> inout)
 357  {
 358    // Find out about the block's actual layout.
 359    Rt_layout<1> rtl_inout = block_layout<1>(inout.block()); 
 360    
 361    // Find out about what layout is acceptable for this backend.
 362    backend->query_layout(rtl_inout);
 363
 364#if VSIP_IMPL_CUDA_FFT
 365    if (backend->supports_cuda_memory())
 366    {
 367      // The data is either already on GPU or must be brought over before
 368      // calling the backend.  Device_memory knows how to handle both.
 369      cuda::Device_memory<BlockT> dev_inout(inout.block(), SYNC_INOUT, &rtl_inout);
 370      
 371      backend->in_place(dev_inout.data(), dev_inout.stride(0), dev_inout.size(0));
 372    }
 373    else
 374#endif
 375    {
 376      // Create a 'direct data accessor', adjusting the block layout if necessary.
 377      Rt_ext_data<BlockT> inout_ext(inout.block(), rtl_inout, SYNC_INOUT,
 378				    input_buffer_.get());
 379    
 380      // Call the backend.
 381      if (rtl_inout.complex == cmplx_inter_fmt) 
 382	backend->in_place(inout_ext.data().as_inter(),
 383			  inout_ext.stride(0), inout_ext.size(0));
 384      else
 385	backend->in_place(inout_ext.data().as_split(),
 386			  inout_ext.stride(0), inout_ext.size(0));
 387    }
 388
 389    // Scale the data if not already done by the backend.
 390    if (!backend->supports_scale() && !almost_equal(scale_, T(1.)))
 391      inout *= scale_;
 392  }
 393
 394  T scale() const { return scale_; }
 395
 396private:
 397  T scale_;
 398  aligned_array<std::complex<T> > input_buffer_;
 399  aligned_array<std::complex<T> > output_buffer_;
 400  bool inter_fastpath_ok_;
 401  bool split_fastpath_ok_;
 402};
 403
 404
 405template <typename T>
 406class workspace<1, T, std::complex<T> >
 407{
 408public:
 409  template <typename BE>
 410  workspace(BE*, Domain<1> const &in, Domain<1> const &out, T scale)
 411    : scale_(scale),
 412      input_buffer_(in.size()),
 413      output_buffer_(out.size())
 414  {}
 415  
 416  template <typename BE, typename Block0, typename Block1>
 417  void by_reference(BE *backend,
 418		    const_Vector<T, Block0> in,
 419		    Vector<std::complex<T>, Block1> out)
 420    const
 421  {
 422    // Find out about the blocks's actual layout.
 423    Rt_layout<1> rtl_in = block_layout<1>(in.block()); 
 424    Rt_layout<1> rtl_out = block_layout<1>(out.block()); 
 425    
 426    // Find out about what layout is acceptable for this backend.
 427    backend->query_layout(rtl_in, rtl_out);
 428
 429#if VSIP_IMPL_CUDA_FFT
 430    if (backend->supports_cuda_memory())
 431    {
 432      // The data is either already in device memory or must be brought 
 433      // over before calling the backend.  Device_memory returns a pointer to
 434      // the appropriate memory space depending on the underlying block type.
 435      cuda::Device_memory<Block0 const> dev_in(in.block(), SYNC_IN, &rtl_in);
 436      cuda::Device_memory<Block1> dev_out(out.block(), SYNC_OUT, &rtl_out);
 437      
 438      backend->by_reference(dev_in.data(), dev_in.stride(0),
 439                            dev_out.data(), dev_out.stride(0),
 440			    dev_out.size(0));
 441    }
 442    else
 443#endif
 444    {
 445      // Check whether the input buffer will be destroyed.
 446      sync_action_type in_sync = backend->requires_copy(rtl_in)
 447        ? SYNC_IN_NOPRESERVE
 448        : SYNC_IN; 
 449      {
 450        // Create a 'direct data accessor', adjusting the block layout if necessary.
 451        Rt_ext_data<Block0> in_ext(in.block(), rtl_in, in_sync,
 452          input_buffer_.get());
 453        Rt_ext_data<Block1> out_ext(out.block(), rtl_out, SYNC_OUT,
 454          output_buffer_.get());
 455    
 456        // Call the backend.
 457        if (rtl_out.complex == cmplx_inter_fmt) 
 458          backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_real(), in_ext.stride(0),
 459            out_ext.data().as_inter(), out_ext.stride(0),
 460            in_ext.size(0));
 461        else
 462          backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_real(), in_ext.stride(0),
 463            out_ext.data().as_split(), out_ext.stride(0),
 464            in_ext.size(0));
 465      }
 466    }
 467
 468    // Scale the data if not already done by the backend.
 469    if (!backend->supports_scale() && !almost_equal(scale_, T(1.)))
 470      out *= scale_;
 471  }
 472
 473  template <typename BE, typename Block0, typename Block1>
 474  void by_reference_blk(
 475    BE*           backend,
 476    Block0 const& in,
 477    Block1&       out)
 478    const
 479  {
 480    // Find out about the blocks's actual layout.
 481    Rt_layout<1> rtl_in = block_layout<1>(in); 
 482    Rt_layout<1> rtl_out = block_layout<1>(out); 
 483    
 484    // Find out about what layout is acceptable for this backend.
 485    backend->query_layout(rtl_in, rtl_out);
 486
 487#if VSIP_IMPL_CUDA_FFT
 488    if (backend->supports_cuda_memory())
 489    {
 490      // The data is either already in device memory or must be brought 
 491      // over before calling the backend.  Device_memory returns a pointer to
 492      // the appropriate memory space depending on the underlying block type.
 493      cuda::Device_memory<Block0 const> dev_in(in, SYNC_IN, &rtl_in);
 494      cuda::Device_memory<Block1> dev_out(out, SYNC_OUT, &rtl_out);
 495      
 496      backend->by_reference(const_cast<T*>(dev_in.data()), dev_in.stride(0),
 497                            dev_out.data(), dev_out.stride(0),
 498			    dev_out.size(0));
 499    }
 500    else 
 501#endif
 502    {
 503      typedef typename Proper_type_of<Block0>::type block0_type;
 504
 505      // Check whether the input buffer will be destroyed.
 506      sync_action_type in_sync = backend->requires_copy(rtl_in)
 507        ? SYNC_IN_NOPRESERVE
 508        : SYNC_IN; 
 509      {
 510        // Create a 'direct data accessor', adjusting the block layout if necessary.
 511        Rt_ext_data<block0_type> in_ext(in, rtl_in, in_sync,
 512          input_buffer_.get());
 513        Rt_ext_data<Block1> out_ext(out, rtl_out, SYNC_OUT,
 514          output_buffer_.get());
 515    
 516        // Call the backend.
 517        if (rtl_out.complex == cmplx_inter_fmt) 
 518          backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_real(), in_ext.stride(0),
 519            out_ext.data().as_inter(), out_ext.stride(0),
 520            in_ext.size(0));
 521        else
 522          backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_real(), in_ext.stride(0),
 523            out_ext.data().as_split(), out_ext.stride(0),
 524            in_ext.size(0));
 525      }
 526    }
 527
 528    // Scale the data if not already done by the backend.
 529    if (!backend->supports_scale() && !almost_equal(scale_, T(1.)))
 530      scale_block(scale_, out);
 531  }
 532
 533  T scale() const { return scale_; }
 534
 535private:
 536  T scale_;
 537  aligned_array<T> input_buffer_;
 538  aligned_array<std::complex<T> > output_buffer_;
 539};
 540
 541template <typename T>
 542class workspace<1, std::complex<T>, T>
 543{
 544public:
 545  template <typename BE>
 546  workspace(BE*, Domain<1> const &in, Domain<1> const &out, T scale)
 547    : scale_(scale),
 548      input_buffer_(in.size()),
 549      output_buffer_(out.size())
 550  {}
 551  
 552  template <typename BE, typename Block0, typename Block1>
 553  void by_reference(BE *backend,
 554		    const_Vector<std::complex<T>, Block0> in,
 555		    Vector<T, Block1> out)
 556    const
 557  {
 558    // Find out about the blocks's actual layout.
 559    Rt_layout<1> rtl_in = block_layout<1>(in.block()); 
 560    Rt_layout<1> rtl_out = block_layout<1>(out.block()); 
 561    
 562    // Find out about what layout is acceptable for this backend.
 563    backend->query_layout(rtl_in, rtl_out);
 564
 565#if VSIP_IMPL_CUDA_FFT
 566    if (backend->supports_cuda_memory())
 567    {
 568      cuda::Device_memory<Block0 const> dev_in(in.block(), SYNC_IN, &rtl_in);
 569      cuda::Device_memory<Block1> dev_out(out.block(), SYNC_OUT, &rtl_out);
 570      
 571      backend->by_reference(dev_in.data(), dev_in.stride(0),
 572                            dev_out.data(), dev_out.stride(0),
 573			    dev_out.size(0));
 574    }
 575    else
 576#endif
 577    {
 578      // Check whether the input buffer will be destroyed.
 579      sync_action_type in_sync = backend->requires_copy(rtl_in)
 580        ? SYNC_IN_NOPRESERVE
 581        : SYNC_IN;
 582      { 
 583        // Create a 'direct data accessor', adjusting the block layout if necessary.
 584        Rt_ext_data<Block0> in_ext(in.block(), rtl_in, in_sync,
 585          input_buffer_.get());
 586        Rt_ext_data<Block1> out_ext(out.block(), rtl_out, SYNC_OUT,
 587          output_buffer_.get());
 588    
 589        // Call the backend.
 590        if (rtl_in.complex == cmplx_inter_fmt) 
 591          backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_inter(), in_ext.stride(0),
 592            out_ext.data().as_real(), out_ext.stride(0),
 593            out_ext.size(0));
 594        else
 595          backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_split(), in_ext.stride(0),
 596            out_ext.data().as_real(), out_ext.stride(0),
 597            out_ext.size(0));
 598      }
 599    }
 600
 601    // Scale the data if not already done by the backend.
 602    if (!backend->supports_scale() && !almost_equal(scale_, T(1.)))
 603      out *= scale_;
 604  }
 605
 606  template <typename BE, typename Block0, typename Block1>
 607  void by_reference_blk(
 608    BE*           backend,
 609    Block0 const& in,
 610    Block1&       out)
 611    const
 612  {
 613    // Find out about the blocks's actual layout.
 614    Rt_layout<1> rtl_in = block_layout<1>(in); 
 615    Rt_layout<1> rtl_out = block_layout<1>(out); 
 616    
 617    // Find out about what layout is acceptable for this backend.
 618    backend->query_layout(rtl_in, rtl_out);
 619
 620#if VSIP_IMPL_CUDA_FFT
 621    if (backend->supports_cuda_memory())
 622    {
 623      cuda::Device_memory<Block0 const> dev_in(in, SYNC_IN, &rtl_in);
 624      cuda::Device_memory<Block1> dev_out(out, SYNC_OUT, &rtl_out);
 625      
 626      backend->by_reference(const_cast<std::complex<T>*>(dev_in.data()), 1,
 627			    dev_out.data(), 1,
 628			    out.size());
 629    }
 630    else 
 631#endif
 632    {
 633      // Check whether the input buffer will be destroyed.
 634      sync_action_type in_sync = backend->requires_copy(rtl_in)
 635        ? SYNC_IN_NOPRESERVE
 636        : SYNC_IN;
 637      { 
 638        // Create a 'direct data accessor', adjusting the block layout if necessary.
 639        Rt_ext_data<Block0> in_ext(in, rtl_in, in_sync,
 640          input_buffer_.get());
 641        Rt_ext_data<Block1> out_ext(out, rtl_out, SYNC_OUT,
 642          output_buffer_.get());
 643    
 644        // Call the backend.
 645        if (rtl_in.complex == cmplx_inter_fmt) 
 646          backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_inter(), in_ext.stride(0),
 647            out_ext.data().as_real(), out_ext.stride(0),
 648            out_ext.size(0));
 649        else
 650          backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_split(), in_ext.stride(0),
 651            out_ext.data().as_real(), out_ext.stride(0),
 652            out_ext.size(0));
 653      }
 654    }
 655
 656    // Scale the data if not already done by the backend.
 657    if (!backend->supports_scale() && !almost_equal(scale_, T(1.)))
 658      scale_block(scale_, out);
 659  }
 660
 661  T scale() const { return scale_; }
 662
 663private:
 664  T scale_;
 665  aligned_array<std::complex<T> > input_buffer_;
 666  aligned_array<T> output_buffer_;
 667};
 668
 669template <typename T>
 670class workspace<2, std::complex<T>, std::complex<T> >
 671{
 672public:
 673  template <typename BE>
 674  workspace(BE* backend, Domain<2> const& in, Domain<2> const& out, T scale)
 675    : scale_(scale),
 676      input_buffer_size_ (inout_size<std::complex<T>, true> (backend, in)),
 677      output_buffer_size_(inout_size<std::complex<T>, false>(backend, out)),
 678      input_buffer_      (input_buffer_size_),
 679      output_buffer_     (output_buffer_size_)
 680  {}
 681  
 682  template <typename BE, typename Block0, typename Block1>
 683  void by_reference(BE *backend,
 684		    const_Matrix<std::complex<T>, Block0> in,
 685		    Matrix<std::complex<T>, Block1> out)
 686    const
 687  {
 688    // Find out about the blocks's actual layout.
 689    Rt_layout<2> rtl_in = block_layout<2>(in.block()); 
 690    Rt_layout<2> rtl_out = block_layout<2>(out.block()); 
 691    
 692    // Find out about what layout is acceptable for this backend.
 693    backend->query_layout(rtl_in, rtl_out);
 694
 695#if VSIP_IMPL_CUDA_FFT
 696    if (backend->supports_cuda_memory())
 697    {
 698      Block0& in_block = in.block();
 699      Block1& out_block = out.block();
 700      cuda::Device_memory<Block0 const> dev_in(in_block, SYNC_IN, &rtl_in);
 701      cuda::Device_memory<Block1> dev_out(out_block, SYNC_OUT, &rtl_out);
 702
 703      backend->by_reference(dev_in.data(), dev_in.stride(0), dev_in.stride(1),
 704			    dev_out.data(), dev_out.stride(0), dev_out.stride(1),
 705			    dev_out.size(0), dev_out.size(1));
 706    }
 707    else
 708#endif
 709    {
 710      // Check whether the input buffer will be destroyed.
 711      sync_action_type in_sync = backend->requires_copy(rtl_in)
 712        ? SYNC_IN_NOPRESERVE
 713        : SYNC_IN; 
 714      {
 715        // Create a 'direct data accessor', adjusting the block layout if necessary.
 716        Rt_ext_data<Block0> in_ext(in.block(), rtl_in, in_sync,
 717                                   input_buffer_.get());
 718        Rt_ext_data<Block1> out_ext(out.block(), rtl_out, SYNC_OUT,
 719                                    output_buffer_.get());
 720    
 721        // Call the backend.
 722        assert(rtl_in.complex == rtl_out.complex);
 723        if (rtl_in.complex == cmplx_inter_fmt) 
 724          backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_inter(),
 725                                in_ext.stride(0), in_ext.stride(1),
 726                                out_ext.data().as_inter(),
 727                                out_ext.stride(0), out_ext.stride(1),
 728                                in_ext.size(0), in_ext.size(1));
 729        else
 730          backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_split(),
 731                                in_ext.stride(0), in_ext.stride(1),
 732                                out_ext.data().as_split(),
 733                                out_ext.stride(0), out_ext.stride(1),
 734                                in_ext.size(0), in_ext.size(1));
 735      }
 736    }
 737
 738    // Scale the data if not already done by the backend.
 739    if (!backend->supports_scale() && !almost_equal(scale_, T(1.)))
 740      out *= scale_;
 741  }
 742
 743  template <typename BE, typename Block0, typename Block1>
 744  void by_reference_blk(
 745    BE*           backend,
 746    Block0 const& in,
 747    Block1&       out)
 748    const
 749  {
 750    // Find out about the blocks's actual layout.
 751    Rt_layout<2> rtl_in  = block_layout<2>(in);
 752    Rt_layout<2> rtl_out = block_layout<2>(out);
 753    
 754    // Find out about what layout is acceptable for this backend.
 755    backend->query_layout(rtl_in, rtl_out);
 756
 757#if VSIP_IMPL_CUDA_FFT
 758    if (backend->supports_cuda_memory())
 759    {
 760      cuda::Device_memory<Block0 const> dev_in(in, SYNC_IN, &rtl_in);
 761      cuda::Device_memory<Block1> dev_out(out, SYNC_OUT, &rtl_out);
 762      
 763      typedef typename Block0::value_type value_type;
 764      backend->by_reference(const_cast<value_type*>(dev_in.data()),
 765                                            dev_in.stride(0), dev_in.stride(1),
 766			    dev_out.data(), dev_out.stride(0), dev_out.stride(1),
 767			    dev_out.size(0), dev_out.size(1));
 768    }
 769    else
 770#endif
 771    {
 772      typedef typename Proper_type_of<Block0>::type proper_block0_type;
 773
 774      // Check whether the input buffer will be destroyed (and hence
 775      // should be a copy), or whether the input block aliases the
 776      // output (and hence should be a copy).
 777      //
 778      // The input and output may alias when using return-block
 779      // optimization for by-value Fft: 'A = fft(A)'.
 780      sync_action_type in_sync =
 781        (backend->requires_copy(rtl_in) || is_alias(in, out))
 782        ? SYNC_IN_NOPRESERVE
 783        : SYNC_IN; 
 784      {
 785        // Create a 'direct data accessor', adjusting the block layout if necessary.
 786        Rt_ext_data<proper_block0_type> in_ext(in, rtl_in, in_sync,
 787                                               input_buffer_.get());
 788        Rt_ext_data<Block1> out_ext(out, rtl_out, SYNC_OUT,
 789                                    output_buffer_.get());
 790    
 791        // Call the backend.
 792        assert(rtl_in.complex == rtl_out.complex);
 793        if (rtl_in.complex == cmplx_inter_fmt) 
 794          backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_inter(),
 795                                in_ext.stride(0), in_ext.stride(1),
 796                                out_ext.data().as_inter(),
 797                                out_ext.stride(0), out_ext.stride(1),
 798                                in_ext.size(0), in_ext.size(1));
 799        else
 800          backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_split(),
 801                                in_ext.stride(0), in_ext.stride(1),
 802                                out_ext.data().as_split(),
 803                                out_ext.stride(0), out_ext.stride(1),
 804                                in_ext.size(0), in_ext.size(1));
 805      }
 806    }
 807
 808    // Scale the data if not already done by the backend.
 809    if (!backend->supports_scale() && !almost_equal(scale_, T(1.)))
 810      scale_block(scale_, out);
 811  }
 812
 813  template <typename BE, typename BlockT>
 814  void in_place(BE *backend, Matrix<std::complex<T>,BlockT> inout)
 815  {
 816    // Find out about the block's actual layout.
 817    Rt_layout<2> rtl_inout = block_layout<2>(inout.block()); 
 818    
 819    // Find out about what layout is acceptable for this backend.
 820    backend->query_layout(rtl_inout);
 821
 822#if VSIP_IMPL_CUDA_FFT
 823    if (backend->supports_cuda_memory())
 824    {
 825      BlockT& block = inout.block();
 826      cuda::Device_memory<BlockT> dev_inout(block, SYNC_INOUT, &rtl_inout);
 827
 828      backend->in_place(dev_inout.data(),
 829                        dev_inout.stride(0), dev_inout.stride(1),
 830                        dev_inout.size(0), dev_inout.size(1));
 831    }
 832    else 
 833#endif
 834    {
 835      // Create a 'direct data accessor', adjusting the block layout if necessary.
 836      Rt_ext_data<BlockT> inout_ext(inout.block(), rtl_inout, SYNC_INOUT,
 837        input_buffer_.get(),
 838        input_buffer_size_);
 839    
 840      // Call the backend.
 841      if (rtl_inout.complex == cmplx_inter_fmt) 
 842        backend->in_place(inout_ext.data().as_inter(),
 843          inout_ext.stride(0), inout_ext.stride(1), 
 844          inout_ext.size(0), inout_ext.size(1));
 845      else
 846        backend->in_place(inout_ext.data().as_split(),
 847          inout_ext.stride(0), inout_ext.stride(1),
 848          inout_ext.size(0), inout_ext.size(1));
 849    }
 850     
 851    // Scale the data if not already done by the backend.
 852    if (!backend->supports_scale() && !almost_equal(scale_, T(1.)))
 853      inout *= scale_;
 854  }
 855
 856  T scale() const { return scale_; }
 857
 858private:
 859  T scale_;
 860  length_type input_buffer_size_;
 861  length_type output_buffer_size_;
 862  aligned_array<std::complex<T> > input_buffer_;
 863  aligned_array<std::complex<T> > output_buffer_;
 864};
 865
 866template <typename T>
 867class workspace<2, T, std::complex<T> >
 868{
 869public:
 870  template <typename BE>
 871  workspace(BE* backend, Domain<2> const &in, Domain<2> const &out, T scale)
 872    : scale_(scale),
 873      input_buffer_ (inout_size_opo<T,               true> (backend, in)),
 874      output_buffer_(inout_size_opo<std::complex<T>, false>(backend, out))
 875  {}
 876  
 877  template <typename BE, typename Block0, typename Block1>
 878  void by_reference(BE *backend,
 879		    const_Matrix<T, Block0> in,
 880		    Matrix<std::complex<T>, Block1> out)
 881    const
 882  {
 883    // Find out about the blocks's actual layout.
 884    Rt_layout<2> rtl_in = block_layout<2>(in.block()); 
 885    Rt_layout<2> rtl_out = block_layout<2>(out.block()); 
 886    
 887    // Find out about what layout is acceptable for this backend.
 888    backend->query_layout(rtl_in, rtl_out);
 889
 890#if VSIP_IMPL_CUDA_FFT
 891    if (backend->supports_cuda_memory())
 892    {
 893      Block0& in_block = in.block();
 894      Block1& out_block = out.block();
 895      cuda::Device_memory<Block0 const> dev_in(in_block, SYNC_IN, &rtl_in);
 896      cuda::Device_memory<Block1> dev_out(out_block, SYNC_OUT, &rtl_out);
 897      
 898      backend->by_reference(dev_in.data(), dev_in.stride(0), dev_in.stride(1),
 899                            dev_out.data(), dev_out.stride(0), dev_out.stride(1),
 900                            dev_out.size(0), dev_out.size(1));
 901    }
 902    else
 903#endif
 904    {
 905      // Check whether the input buffer will be destroyed.
 906      sync_action_type in_sync = backend->requires_copy(rtl_in)
 907        ? SYNC_IN_NOPRESERVE
 908        : SYNC_IN; 
 909      {
 910        // Create a 'direct data accessor', adjusting the block layout if necessary.
 911        Rt_ext_data<Block0> in_ext(in.block(), rtl_in, in_sync, 
 912                                   input_buffer_.get());
 913        Rt_ext_data<Block1> out_ext(out.block(), rtl_out, SYNC_OUT,
 914                                    output_buffer_.get());
 915    
 916        // Call the backend.
 917        if (rtl_out.complex == cmplx_inter_fmt) 
 918          backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_real(),
 919                                in_ext.stride(0), in_ext.stride(1),
 920                                out_ext.data().as_inter(),
 921                                out_ext.stride(0), out_ext.stride(1),
 922                                in_ext.size(0), in_ext.size(1));
 923        else
 924          backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_real(),
 925                                in_ext.stride(0), in_ext.stride(1),
 926                                out_ext.data().as_split(),
 927                                out_ext.stride(0), out_ext.stride(1),
 928                                in_ext.size(0), in_ext.size(1));
 929      }
 930    }
 931
 932    // Scale the data if not already done by the backend.
 933    if (!backend->supports_scale() && !almost_equal(scale_, T(1.)))
 934      out *= scale_;
 935  }
 936
 937  template <typename BE, typename Block0, typename Block1>
 938  void by_reference_blk(
 939    BE*           backend,
 940    Block0 const& in,
 941    Block1&       out)
 942    const
 943  {
 944    // Find out about the blocks's actual layout.
 945    Rt_layout<2> rtl_in = block_layout<2>(in);
 946    Rt_layout<2> rtl_out = block_layout<2>(out);
 947    
 948    // Find out about what layout is acceptable for this backend.
 949    backend->query_layout(rtl_in, rtl_out);
 950
 951#if VSIP_IMPL_CUDA_FFT
 952    if (backend->supports_cuda_memory())
 953    {
 954      cuda::Device_memory<Block0 const> dev_in(in, SYNC_IN, &rtl_in);
 955      cuda::Device_memory<Block1> dev_out(out, SYNC_OUT, &rtl_out);
 956      
 957      backend->by_reference(dev_in.data(), dev_in.stride(0), dev_in.stride(1),
 958			    dev_out.data(), dev_out.stride(0), dev_out.stride(1),
 959			    dev_out.size(0), dev_out.size(1));
 960    }
 961    else
 962#endif
 963    {
 964      // Check whether the input buffer will be destroyed.
 965      sync_action_type in_sync = backend->requires_copy(rtl_in)
 966        ? SYNC_IN_NOPRESERVE
 967        : SYNC_IN; 
 968      {
 969        // Create a 'direct data accessor', adjusting the block layout if necessary.
 970        Rt_ext_data<Block0> in_ext(in, rtl_in, in_sync, 
 971                                   input_buffer_.get());
 972        Rt_ext_data<Block1> out_ext(out, rtl_out, SYNC_OUT,
 973                                    output_buffer_.get());
 974    
 975        // Call the backend.
 976        if (rtl_out.complex == cmplx_inter_fmt) 
 977          backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_real(),
 978                                in_ext.stride(0), in_ext.stride(1),
 979                                out_ext.data().as_inter(),
 980                                out_ext.stride(0), out_ext.stride(1),
 981                                in_ext.size(0), in_ext.size(1));
 982        else
 983          backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_real(),
 984                                in_ext.stride(0), in_ext.stride(1),
 985                                out_ext.data().as_split(),
 986                                out_ext.stride(0), out_ext.stride(1),
 987                                in_ext.size(0), in_ext.size(1));
 988      }
 989    }
 990
 991    // Scale the data if not already done by the backend.
 992    if (!backend->supports_scale() && !almost_equal(scale_, T(1.)))
 993      scale_block(scale_, out);
 994  }
 995
 996  T scale() const { return scale_; }
 997
 998private:
 999  T scale_;
1000  aligned_array<T> input_buffer_;
1001  aligned_array<std::complex<T> > output_buffer_;
1002};

1004template <typename T>
1005class workspace<2, std::complex<T>, T >
1006{
1007public:
1008  template <typename BE>
1009  workspace(BE* backend, Domain<2> const &in, Domain<2> const &out, T scale)
1010    : scale_(scale),
1011      input_buffer_ (inout_size_opo<std::complex<T>, true> (backend, in)),
1012      output_buffer_(inout_size_opo<T,               false>(backend, out))
1013  {}
1014  
1015  template <typename BE, typename Block0, typename Block1>
1016  void by_reference(BE *backend,
1017		    const_Matrix<std::complex<T>, Block0> in,
1018		    Matrix<T, Block1> out)
1019    const
1020  {
1021    // Find out about the blocks's actual layout.
1022    Rt_layout<2> rtl_in = block_layout<2>(in.block()); 
1023    Rt_layout<2> rtl_out = block_layout<2>(out.block()); 
1024    
1025    // Find out about what layout is acceptable for this backend.
1026    backend->query_layout(rtl_in, rtl_out);
1027
1028#if VSIP_IMPL_CUDA_FFT
1029    if (backend->supports_cuda_memory())
1030    {
1031      Block0& in_block = in.block();
1032      Block1& out_block = out.block();
1033      cuda::Device_memory<Block0 const> dev_in(in_block, SYNC_IN, &rtl_in);
1034      cuda::Device_memory<Block1> dev_out(out_block, SYNC_OUT, &rtl_out);
1035      
1036      backend->by_reference(dev_in.data(), dev_in.stride(0), dev_in.stride(1),
1037                            dev_out.data(), dev_out.stride(0), dev_out.stride(1),
1038                            dev_out.size(0), dev_out.size(1));
1039    }
1040    else
1041#endif
1042    {
1043      // Check whether the input buffer will be destroyed.
1044      sync_action_type in_sync = backend->requires_copy(rtl_in)
1045        ? SYNC_IN_NOPRESERVE
1046        : SYNC_IN;
1047      { 
1048        // Create a 'direct data accessor', adjusting the block layout if necessary.
1049        Rt_ext_data<Block0> in_ext(in.block(), rtl_in, in_sync,
1050                                   input_buffer_.get());
1051        Rt_ext_data<Block1> out_ext(out.block(), rtl_out, SYNC_OUT,
1052                                    output_buffer_.get());
1053        // Call the backend.
1054        if (rtl_in.complex == cmplx_inter_fmt) 
1055          backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_inter(),
1056                                in_ext.stride(0), in_ext.stride(1),
1057                                out_ext.data().as_real(),
1058                                out_ext.stride(0), out_ext.stride(1),
1059                                out_ext.size(0), out_ext.size(1));
1060        else
1061          backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_split(),
1062                                in_ext.stride(0), in_ext.stride(1),
1063                                out_ext.data().as_real(),
1064                                out_ext.stride(0), out_ext.stride(1),
1065                                out_ext.size(0), out_ext.size(1));
1066      }
1067    }
1068
1069    // Scale the data if not already done by the backend.
1070    if (!backend->supports_scale() && !almost_equal(scale_, T(1.)))
1071      out *= scale_;
1072  }
1073
1074  template <typename BE, typename Block0, typename Block1>
1075  void by_reference_blk(
1076    BE*           backend,
1077    Block0 const& in,
1078    Block1&       out)
1079    const
1080  {
1081    // Find out about the blocks's actual layout.
1082    Rt_layout<2> rtl_in = block_layout<2>(in); 
1083    Rt_layout<2> rtl_out = block_layout<2>(out); 
1084    
1085    // Find out about what layout is acceptable for this backend.
1086    backend->query_layout(rtl_in, rtl_out);
1087
1088#if VSIP_IMPL_CUDA_FFT
1089    if (backend->supports_cuda_memory())
1090    {
1091      cuda::Device_memory<Block0 const> dev_in(in, SYNC_IN, &rtl_in);
1092      cuda::Device_memory<Block1> dev_out(out, SYNC_OUT, &rtl_out);
1093      
1094      backend->by_reference(dev_in.data(), dev_in.stride(0), dev_in.stride(1),
1095                            dev_out.data(), dev_out.stride(0), dev_out.stride(1),
1096                            dev_out.size(0), dev_out.size(1));
1097    }
1098    else
1099#endif
1100    {
1101      // Check whether the input buffer will be destroyed.
1102      sync_action_type in_sync = backend->requires_copy(rtl_in)
1103        ? SYNC_IN_NOPRESERVE
1104        : SYNC_IN;
1105      { 
1106        // Create a 'direct data accessor', adjusting the block layout if necessary.
1107        Rt_ext_data<Block0> in_ext(in, rtl_in, in_sync,
1108                                   input_buffer_.get());
1109        Rt_ext_data<Block1> out_ext(out, rtl_out, SYNC_OUT,
1110                                    output_buffer_.get());
1111    
1112        // Call the backend.
1113        if (rtl_in.complex == cmplx_inter_fmt) 
1114          backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_inter(),
1115                                in_ext.stride(0), in_ext.stride(1),
1116                                out_ext.data().as_real(),
1117                                out_ext.stride(0), out_ext.stride(1),
1118                                out_ext.size(0), out_ext.size(1));
1119        else
1120          backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_split(),
1121                                in_ext.stride(0), in_ext.stride(1),
1122                                out_ext.data().as_real(),
1123                                out_ext.stride(0), out_ext.stride(1),
1124                                out_ext.size(0), out_ext.size(1));
1125      }
1126    }
1127
1128    // Scale the data if not already done by the backend.
1129    if (!backend->supports_scale() && !almost_equal(scale_, T(1.)))
1130      scale_block(scale_, out);
1131  }
1132
1133  T scale() const { return scale_; }
1134
1135private:
1136  T scale_;
1137  aligned_array<std::complex<T> > input_buffer_;
1138  aligned_array<T> output_buffer_;
1139};
1140
1141template <typename T>
1142class workspace<3, std::complex<T>, std::complex<T> >
1143{
1144public:
1145  template <typename BE>
1146  workspace(BE*, Domain<3> const &in, Domain<3> const &out, T scale)
1147    : scale_(scale),
1148      input_buffer_(in.size()),
1149      output_buffer_(out.size())
1150  {}
1151  
1152  template <typename BE, typename Block0, typename Block1>
1153  void by_reference_blk(
1154    BE*           backend,
1155    Block0 const& in,
1156    Block1&       out)
1157    const
1158  {
1159    // Find out about the blocks's actual layout.
1160    Rt_layout<3> rtl_in = block_layout<3>(in); 
1161    Rt_layout<3> rtl_out = block_layout<3>(out); 
1162    
1163    // Find out about what layout is acceptable for this backend.
1164    backend->query_layout(rtl_in, rtl_out);
1165
1166    // Check whether the input buffer will be destroyed.
1167    sync_action_type in_sync = backend->requires_copy(rtl_in)
1168      ? SYNC_IN_NOPRESERVE
1169      : SYNC_IN; 
1170    {
1171      // Create a 'direct data accessor', adjusting the block layout if necessary.
1172      Rt_ext_data<Block0> in_ext(in, rtl_in, in_sync,
1173				 input_buffer_.get());
1174      Rt_ext_data<Block1> out_ext(out, rtl_out, SYNC_OUT,
1175				  output_buffer_.get());
1176    
1177      // Call the backend.
1178      assert(rtl_in.complex == rtl_out.complex);
1179      if (rtl_in.complex == cmplx_inter_fmt) 
1180	backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_inter(),
1181			      in_ext.stride(0),
1182			      in_ext.stride(1),
1183			      in_ext.stride(2),
1184			      out_ext.data().as_inter(),
1185			      out_ext.stride(0),
1186			      out_ext.stride(1),
1187			      out_ext.stride(2),
1188			      in_ext.size(0),
1189			      in_ext.size(1),
1190			      in_ext.size(2));
1191      else
1192	backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_split(),
1193			      in_ext.stride(0),
1194			      in_ext.stride(1),
1195			      in_ext.stride(2),
1196			      out_ext.data().as_split(),
1197			      out_ext.stride(0),
1198			      out_ext.stride(1),
1199			      out_ext.stride(2),
1200			      in_ext.size(0),
1201			      in_ext.size(1),
1202			      in_ext.size(2));
1203    }
1204    // Scale the data if not already done by the backend.
1205    if (!backend->supports_scale() && !almost_equal(scale_, T(1.)))
1206      scale_block(scale_, out);
1207  }
1208
1209  template <typename BE, typename Block0, typename Block1>
1210  void by_reference(BE *backend,
1211		    const_Tensor<std::complex<T>, Block0> in,
1212		    Tensor<std::complex<T>, Block1> out)
1213    const
1214  {
1215    // Find out about the blocks's actual layout.
1216    Rt_layout<3> rtl_in = block_layout<3>(in.block()); 
1217    Rt_layout<3> rtl_out = block_layout<3>(out.block()); 
1218

1220    backend->query_layout(rtl_in, rtl_out);

1223    sync_action_type in_sync = backend->requires_copy(rtl_in)
1224      ? SYNC_IN_NOPRESERVE
1225      : SYNC_IN; 
1226    {
1227      // Create a 'direct data accessor', adjusting the block layout if necessary.
1228      Rt_ext_data<Block0> in_ext(in.block(), rtl_in, in_sync,
1229				 input_buffer_.get());
1230      Rt_ext_data<Block1> out_ext(out.block(), rtl_out, SYNC_OUT,
1231				  output_buffer_.get());
1232    
1233      // Call the backend.
1234      assert(rtl_in.complex == rtl_out.complex);
1235      if (rtl_in.complex == cmplx_inter_fmt) 
1236	backend->by_reference(in_ext.data().as_inter(),
1237			      in_ext.stride(0),
1238			      in_ext.stride(1),
1239			      in_ext.stride(2),
1240			      out_ext.data().as_inter(),
1241			      out_ext.stride(0),
1242			      out_ext.stride(1),
1243			      out_ext.stride(2),
1244			      in_ext.size(0),
1245			      in_ext.size(1),
1246			      in_ext.size(2));
1247      else

1249			      in_ext.stride(0),

1252			      out_ext.data().as_split(),
1253			      out_ext.stride(0),
1254			      out_ext.stride(1),
1255			      out_ext.stride(2),
1256			      in_ext.size(0),
1257			      in_ext.size(1),
1258			      in_ext.size(2));

1261    if (!backend->supports_scale() && !almost_equal(scale_, T(1.)))

1264
1265  template <typename BE, typename BlockT>
1266  void in_place(BE *backend, Tensor<std::complex<T>,BlockT> inout)
1267  {
1268    // Find out about the block's actual layout.
1269    Rt_layout<3> rtl_inout = block_layout<3>(inout.block()); 
1270    
1271    // Find out about what layout is acceptable for this backend.
1272    backend->query_layout(rtl_inout);
1273    {
1274      // Create a 'direct data accessor', adjusting the block layout if necessary.
1275      Rt_ext_data<BlockT> inout_ext(inout.block(), rtl_inout, SYNC_INOUT,
1276				    input_buffer_.get());
1277    
1278      // Call the backend.
1279      if (rtl_inout.complex == cmplx_inter_fmt) 
1280	backend->in_place(inout_ext.data().as_inter(),
1281			  inout_ext.stride(0),
1282			  inout_ext.stride(1),
1283			  inout_ext.stride(2), 
1284			  inout_ext.size(0),
1285			  inout_ext.size(1),
1286			  inout_ext.size(2));
1287      else
1288	backend->in_place(inout_ext.data().as_split(),
1289			  inout_ext.stride(0),
1290			  inout_ext.stride(1),
1291			  inout_ext.stride(2),
1292			  inout_ext.size(0),
1293			  inout_ext.size(1),
1294			  inout_ext.size(2));
1295    }
1296    // Scale the data if not already done by the backend.
1297    if (!backend->supports_scale() && !almost_equal(scale_, T(1.)))
1298      inout *= scale_;
1299  }
1300
1301  T scale() const { return scale_; }
1302
1303private:
1304  T scale_;
1305  aligned_array<std::complex<T> > input_buffer_;
1306  aligned_array<std::complex<T> > output_buffer_;
1307};
